American technology business Apple Inc. is in Cupertino, California. Consumer devices, computer software, and online services are all created, produced, and sold by this company. One of the most important tech businesses is Apple. In 1976, Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak, and Ronald Wayne founded it in a garage. With the iPhone released in 2007, the iPad in 2010, and the Apple Watch in 2014, Apple joined the smartphone, tablet, and wristwatch markets. The world recognizes the iPhone as one of the most coveted devices, and it has evolved into a status symbol. Visit Fatafat Sewa to know the iPhone price in Nepal.

The MIUI skin is applied to the Android operating system on the POCO smartphone. Laptop Price in Nepal

In today’s fast-paced digital world, owning a reliable laptop has become a necessity for work, education, and entertainment. If you’re in Nepal and planning to buy a laptop in 2025, you’re in the right place. This article provides updated laptop price in Nepal in 2025.Highlights of Pricing Specs and flexible EMI plans available at Fatafat Sewa.


1. Latest Laptop Prices in Nepal 2025

The laptop market in Nepal is booming with options from top brands like HP, Dell, Apple, Asus, and Lenovo. Here’s a quick overview of the latest prices for popular models in 2025:

  1. Budget Laptops (Under NPR 80,000): Ideal for students and casual users.
  2. Mid-Range Laptops (NPR 80,000 - 150,000): Perfect for professionals and gamers.
  3. Premium Laptops (Above NPR 150,000): High-performance devices for heavy tasks and gaming.


2. Top Brands and Their Popular Models

  1. HP: HP Pavilion, HP Envy, and HP Spectre series.
  2. Dell:Dell Inspiron, Dell XPS, and Dell Alienware.
  3. Apple: MacBook Air and MacBook Pro with M-series chips.
  4. Asus:Asus Vivobook, Asus Zenbook, and Asus ROG series.
  5. Lenovo: Lenovo IdeaPad, Lenovo ThinkPad, and Lenovo Legion.


3. EMI Plans at Fatafat Sewa

Fatafat Sewa offers convenient EMI (Equated Monthly Installment) plans to make purchasing laptops more affordable. Here’s why you should consider their EMI options:

  1. Flexible Tenure: Choose repayment periods ranging from 3 to 18 months.
  2. Low Interest Rates: Competitive rates to suit your budget.
  3. Easy Application Process: Quick approval and hassle-free documentation.

Whether you’re a student or a professional, EMI plans can help you own your dream laptop without straining your finances.


4. Tips to Find the Best Deals

  1. Compare Prices: Check multiple products in a similar price range in Fatafat Sewa.
  2. Look for Discounts: Check out the latest offers from Fatafat Sewa in Laptop Deals.
  3. Check Warranty and After-Sales Service: Ensure the laptop comes with a valid warranty and reliable customer support.
  4. Read Reviews: Research user reviews and expert opinions before making a decision.


Where can I purchase the best laptop near me?

When looking for the best laptop at an affordable price in Kathmandu, Nepal, Fatafat Sewa offers a variety of options. Depending on your needs, you can choose from different laptop brands available at these Fatafat Sewa. However, if you want to buy the best laptop at a budget-friendly price and prefer shopping online, Fatafat Sewa is a great choice. categories.title: Water Pump
categories.description:
Water Pump Price in Nepal


This pricing guide will describe the Water Pump Price in Nepal and cover the types of water Pumps like Peripheral water pumps, Submersible water pumps, Crompton water pumps, and Gasoline water pumps.



A water pump is a machine whose primary function is to raise water pressure in order to move liquid (water) from one location to another. Kinetic or rotational energy is transformed by the motor into hydrodynamic energy for fluid flow is its main Principle.


Water Pump Price in Nepal and its types


Electricity, gas, diesel, and in certain remote locations, solar energy, can all be used to operate water pumps. 

Here are some of the types of water pumps:


1. Submersible Pumps


For contractors, industrial operations, commercial operations, and homeowners who want portable dewatering capabilities, submersible water pumps are a great tool. These pumps, whose namesake suggests, are employed to pump out the liquid from which they are completely submerged, and are driven by hermetically sealed motors.


2. Centrifugal Pumps


An impeller is used in centrifugal pumps; fluid enters via the revolving impeller and is ejected out by centrifugal force through the tips of the impeller. This causes the fluid to go toward the pump's exit while increasing its velocity and pressure. A submersible pump is one kind of centrifugal pump. The most typical application for centrifugal water pumps is in agriculture.


3. Positive Displacement Pumps


Positive displacement pumps operate by mechanically contracting and expanding a flexible diaphragm to supply a fixed amount of water. Such pumps have the disadvantage of requiring a very little gap between the revolving pump and the unit's outer edge, notwithstanding their relative efficiency. As a result, rotation may occur at a slow rate.


4. Peripheral Pumps


Peripheral pumps, also known as regenerative pumps, are centrifugal pumps with rotating impellers that have an input and an outlet opening in a mostly circular casing channel. The energy transferred to the fluid handled is very considerable as it circulates frequently between the impeller and the casing channel. 


5. Rotary Displacement Pumps


Gear pumps, screw pumps, hollow disk pumps, rotary vane pumps, and vibratory pumps are examples of rotary displacement pumps. All of these are quite effective because they can work with very viscous fluids, which often flow at higher rates. Most frequently, lubricating oil is circulated via mechanical equipment using such pumps. 


6. Gear pumps


A type of positive displacement pump is a gear pump. It transfers a fluid mechanically by a cyclic pumping action by regularly enclosing a specific amount in interlocking teeth or gears. As a result, it produces a steady, pulse-free flow that is proportionate to the gears' rate of rotation. 


7. Peristaltic Pumps:


Other names for peristaltic pumps include hose pumps and tube pumps. Positive displacement principles are used in this kind of pump to supply fluid into the tubing through rotating rollers. Then it is compressed in a flexible tube, where it expands and creates a vacuum when the roller goes through. 


8. Diaphragm Pumps:

Another kind of positive displacement pump is a membrane or diaphragm pump. Either Teflon, thermoplastic, or rubber is used to make the diaphragm. The right valves on the sides work in conjunction with their reciprocating motion to pump the liquid.

Depending on the use, you can choose from a variety of sizes and makes of water pumps in Nepal. categories.title: Drill Machine
categories.description:
Drill machine price in Nepal


With the aid of drill bits, it is a machine that is used to drill holes into parts or workpieces. Drill bits are also referred to as multi-point cutting tools, and they can have a significant impact on the Material Removal Rate (MRR). While a single-point cutting tool, such as one used in a lathe, might remove material slowly, multi-point cutting tools do it more quickly, increasing MRR. In this article, we will be talking about drill machine price in Nepal with their types. 








Most frequently, a drill machine is used to make holes and insert screws and other small fasteners. They are a fantastic option for quick home improvement jobs. Impact drill machines are more frequently used to install lag bolts, longer screws, and huge quantities of fasteners.


Different Types of drill machines in Nepal


Drilling machines come in a variety of types depending on the purpose, makeup, and material of the workpiece.


1. Automatic Drilling Machine


Want to easily drill holes in a surface? A huge, steady column that can move at a high speed of roughly 60 meters per minute without distorting is a unique characteristic of the autonomous drilling machine. An automatic drilling machine can execute feeding, positioning, clamping, tapping, and unloading automatically by just placing the component to be machined on its surface.


2. Radial drilling machine


A radial drilling machine can be utilized to drill the holes in the specified radial distance. When the component is huge, the Machine vice cannot accommodate its structure. As a result, in order to perform the operation, the component must be set down on the ground and the drilling machine's radial arm must be turned in relation to the component.


3. Multiple Spindle drilling machines


This style of drilling device is frequently referred to as a specialty tool. It is driven by a single motor and has a drill head made up of several spindles. Many holes can be drilled at once using this technique. The multi-spindle drilling machine's main objective is to increase production while cutting down on operating time.


4. Deep hole drilling machine


A machine tool for cutting metal is a deep-hole drilling machine. Almost any metal can have incredibly precise, deep holes drilled into it. In order to drill deeper holes in various components including spindles, barrels, connecting rods, and some oil-well drilling equipment, this sort of drilling machine is typically employed.


5. Portable drilling machine


A smaller, hand-operated power drill called a portable drilling machine is used primarily to create tiny holes in objects up to 12 millimeters in diameter. It has the power to drill a hole through metal, concrete, wood, and plastic. Because of their portability and modest size, portable drill machines are used by industrial workers, homeowners, plumbers, and electricians.


6. Pillar Drilling Machine


A pillar drill machine, also known as an upright drilling machine, is a sophisticated piece of drilling equipment used to create 20- to 40-millimeter holes in wood and metal. Although it resembles a bench drill machine, it has a considerably stronger engine and a larger drilling capacity. The main users of this machine are manufacturing businesses and professional woodworkers.


Brands of drill machines available in Nepal


Below are the brands of drill machines currently available in Nepal.


1. Alpha Drill Machine price and features in Nepal


Features This drilling equipment is simple to use and maintain and is made of the best iron. It is lightweight (just 1000 grams) and portable. This drilling machine, useful for everyday tasks at home, has a soft grip handle with an ergonomic design. This drill machine's sharp insert bits, which let you easily drill a hole, are one of its standout features.


2. Meakida Cordless Drill price in Nepal


Meakida Cordless Drill is used to drill holes in wood to create furniture or to produce detailed decoration pieces on metal surfaces. Your task can be made simple and efficient by this machine. categories.description:
Router Machine Price In Nepal



This pricing guide will describe the router machine price in Nepal and cover the types of router Machines like Fixed-Base Routers, Combo Routers, Plunge routers, Compact routers, Cordless routers, and many more.




A router tool creates cutouts, grooves, and mortises in addition to shaping edges.

Routers are adaptable, strong instruments that can be used to cut, shape, and sculpt materials.


Different Types of Woodworking Routers in Nepal


Here are the various router tools and accessories so you can select the ones that will work best for you.


1. Fixed-Base Router


The fixed base router is a reliable all-purpose router, in our opinion. With this kind of router, edge shaping is quite easy to execute. The bit protrudes from the base by a defined distance. You can either use a fence clamped to the workbench or the edge of the workpiece as a guide for the router.


2. Plunge Router


A plunge router may move up and down on the base since it is connected to it by two smooth metal bars. With this maneuver, you can place the tool over a chosen location and gradually lower it to bore a depression or hole, or to carve a groove. To make cutouts, use a plunge router and the suitable boring or cutting bit.


3. Combo Router


Combination routers combine the advantages of plunging and fixed-base routers. The router may be switched between the fixed base and the plunging base, which are both included. Trimming and shaping edges, creating dovetails, boring holes, carving shapes, and cutting grooves are all included in this.


4. Compact Router


A compact router is a scaled-down version of a fixed-base router, also referred to as a palm router. It's not inherently less powerful, but it's simpler to use because of its compact size. Use a palm router rather than a bulky fixed-base machine when you need to mortise door frames.


5. Cordless Router 


The use of corded palm routers is simple. The same rotating speed as a corded router is possible with a cordless one. However, because of their reduced power, they should only be used for simple tasks like trimming and shaping edges. 


6. Laminate Trimmer


To cut the margins after adhering plastic laminate to a plywood basis, use a router. A laminate trimmer, which is even smaller and lighter than a palm router, is the best router tool for this task. The cord is installed on top of a translucent plastic base.

Generator Price in Nepal


One of the most important appliances in the modern world is the generator. Numerous factors, including natural disasters, load shedding, system failures, and infrastructure breakdowns, can cause electrical outages. In such situations, the globe will become completely dark without generators. We will examine generator price in Nepal and their uses in this article.



Different Types of Generators in Nepal


There are several factors to take into account when choosing a generator type, including the wattage of the appliances you wish to power, the various fuel types employed, and the generator's power capabilities.


1. Portable Generator


This generator type runs on gasoline or diesel. They generate power using a combustion engine, just like standby generators. They are excellent for isolated construction sites where you need to power tools and lights temporarily. 


2. Inverter Generator


A rectifier is used by inverter generators to produce AC power, which is then inverted back into AC to supply continuous current to appliances. These are especially helpful for devices like air conditioners, refrigerators, cars, boats, and recreational vehicles.


3. Gasoline Generator


Gasoline generators are among the most popular options on the list, mainly because gasoline is easily accessible and these generators are on the affordable end of the price spectrum. They can be used for a variety of things, including home and business functions.


4. Diesel Generator


In difficult situations, such as below-freezing temperatures, diesel generators perform well. Because diesel burns at a low temperature and puts less stress on engines. You will spend less money over time on the diesel generator because it uses less fuel.


5. Solar Generator


Solar generators get their energy from the sun's radiation. They employ solar panels to collect solar energy and charge the generator's battery. The generator's ultimate purpose, the production of electricity, is accomplished with this charge. 


6. Natural Gas Generator


Natural gas-powered generators emit fewer emissions than those powered by diesel and gasoline. As natural gas is distributed through gas pipelines, natural gas generators are often the most affordable and don't need any storage.

categories.description:
Wood Planer Machine price in Nepal

Planer Machine is used to create precise flat surfaces and slots. Planer Machine is used to reduce the thickness of a rough surface or to make it flat and smooth. The first planer was invented in 1817 by Englishman Richard Roberts. Wood Planer machine price in Nepal and their many varieties will be covered in this article.





There is mostly  Chinese technology company that manufactures varieties of planer machine. Price ranges for the planer machine (small to large) start at Rs. 4,500 and go up to Rs. 27,000 (Approx).


Type of Planer Machine


Following are the types of planer machines:


1. Double housing type planer


Double housing is one of the most typical types of planer machines used in most workplaces. It consists of a strong, long base with accurately machined guideways that allow a table to move back and forth on it. Two vertical housings, one on either side of the bed's middle, are attached there and are connected at the top by a cross member.


2. Open side planer Machine


There is only one housing on one side of the base of these types of planer machines. In contrast to the double housing that allows for two, this machine is capable of having three tool heads, and only one housing is required. But it can withstand the forces since it is rigid and strong.


3. Pit planer Machine


A huge construction is used in a machine known as a "pit type" planer, where the table is kept fixed in a pit. On a horizontal rail that runs down both sides of the table, the column that supports the cross rail reciprocates.


4. Edge or plate Planer Machine


Plate planer is another name for an edge planer. It is designed specifically for squaring and beveling steel plate edges used for various pressure vessels and shipbuilding projects.


5. Divided table planer Machine


Two tables on the bed of this kind of planer can be reciprocated singly or jointly. When setting the work, this kind of design reduces a lot of idle time. One of the tables is used to set up the work, while the other is utilized for machining in order to maintain continuous production.

The cost of disc mills and their many varieties are covered in the article. A piece of machinery used for crushing or grinding is called a disc mill. The disc mill breaks up rocks, metals, and other materials by rotating steel plates, or discs, inside a machine. The discs may have smooth or serrated edges depending on the kind of material being crushed or ground. In this article, we will examine disc mill price in Nepal and their uses in this article.





Different Types of Disc Mills in Nepal 


The different Disc Mills are listed here so you can choose the ones that will work the best for you.



1. Single disc mill


The grinder has a spinning disc and a fixed disc. With the rapid-release spring mechanism for simple retraction attached to the rotational shaft to prevent inadvertent damage to the grinding plate owing to any metallic foreign particles, the spacing between the plates can be adjusted to give the most germs-free with the least amount of breaking.



2. Double disc mill


Double disc mills come in diameters ranging from 24" to 36" and can be used with 200 HP to 500 HP engines. The double-disc/double-motor configuration enables the mill's applied horsepower to be split between its two ends, enabling increased throughput at higher HP.


3. Vibrating disc mill


The Vibratory Disc Mill is appropriate for grinding medium-hard, brittle, and fibrous materials to analytical fineness in a very rapid, loss-free, and repeatable manner. It is able to process one, two, three, or four samples at once. The closed grinding mechanism ensures that the sample has been fully processed.



Application of Disc Mill 


  1. It is employed in agricultural applications, where it is used to grind harvested grains and corn.

Pressure Washer Price in Nepal


The removal of loose paint, mold, grime, dust, muck, and filth from surfaces and objects like buildings, cars, and concrete surfaces is done by pressure washing, also known as power washing. Pressure washer price in Nepal and their many varieties will be covered in this article.






A device called a pressure washing surface cleaner has two to four high-pressure jets mounted on a rotating bar that pivots while the water is flowing. This motion establishes a consistent cleaning pattern that may quickly clean flat surfaces.



Different Types of Pressure Washers in Nepal



The idea that there are various types of pressure washers may surprise you.


Cold Water Pressure Washers


The most popular kind of pressure washers is those that use cold water. This is because they are generally simpler to operate and more readily available for purchase. However, they may also be used to thoroughly clean your deck and other structures on your property in addition to being wonderful for washing your siding.


Hot Water Pressure Washer


Hot water pressure washers have a maximum temperature of 311 °F. Higher water temperatures enable HW units to clean significantly more effectively. Grease and oils are easier to remove with the pressure of the water when they are loosened by hot water.


Electric Pressure Washers


The most typical pressure washer you will see being utilized at a home is probably an electric pressure washer. These pressure washers are often rather lightweight and very easy to use. The cost of an electric pressure washer will often be slightly lower than that of a gas-powered one.



Gas-Powered Pressure Washers


These pressure washers will have a significant increase in power over the more usual electric pressure washers. With a gas-powered machine, you'll have an easier time completing a large task that requires efficiency. Pressure washers that run on gas are far more portable than those that run on electricity.


Residential Pressure Washers


These types are more appropriate for sporadic use around the house. They are effective in smaller regions that don't call for a robust solution. A domestic pressure washer is frequently used to wash cars, clean gutters, and hose down decks, patios, and walkways.


Commercial Pressure Washers


A commercial pressure washer is an ideal choice for extensive and frequent use. These models can be helpful for many firms and are frequently utilized across a range of industries because they effortlessly handle grease, oil, and tough stains or messes.

Wiring Cable Price in Nepal


The prices and types of products are included in this wiring cable price in Nepal guide. A wire is constructed of a single electrical conductor. Nowadays, practically everything is powered by electricity because of the growth of technology. 


These wires often have a conductor component that is covered in a non-conductive coating and is typically constructed of copper, aluminum, or in some cases, silver.


Wiring cable shop near me

Types of Wiring Cables in Nepal :


There are various wiring kinds, and it is important to understand where each one is used.


1. Triplex wires


Triplex wire, which consists of three separate wires wound around one another, is frequently used for overhead, single-phase service. The "hot" legs of the service are the two insulated conductors, while the "neutral" wire is the bare, uninsulated wire.



2. Main feeder wires


The cables that link the service weather head to the house are known as main power feeder wires. They are constructed using stranded or solid THHN wire, and the installed cable is 25% larger than the required load.



3. Panel feed wires


Power is delivered to the main distribution junction box through the panel feed wires. Typically, these THHN cables are blackly insulted and have ratings of 25% higher than the maximum load current.



4. Non-metallic sheathed wires


For inside wiring, non-metallic or NM-encased wires are utilized. It could be made up of two or more insulated conductors and a ground conductor that is either insulated or bare. For added protection, there is an additional layer of plastic sheathing made of XLPE.



5. Single-strand wires


The most common option for electrical layout within a home is a single conductor wire. It comes in a variety of gauges, colors (for identifying the phase, neutral, and ground), and solid or stranded conductors. Single-stranded wires are simpler to route via conduits, whereas single-solid wires offer better couplings.

categories.title: Air Compressor
categories.description:
Air Compressor Price in Nepal


A mechanical device known as an air compressor transforms power from an electric motor, diesel or gasoline engine, etc. into the air pressure's potential energy. Given that they may be utilized as a power source for electric tools, air compressors are some of the most essential equipment found at construction sites. In this article, we will be talking about air compressor price in Nepal with their types.




There are numerous varieties of air compressors, each with certain advantages and disadvantages.


Types of Air Compressors 


Based on their internal processes, air compressors can be classified as positive displacement or dynamic displacement. The most typical kinds of air compressors are as follows :


1. Positive Displacement


In the positive displacement type, a predetermined volume of air is mechanically compressed and trapped in a compression chamber, increasing the pressure there before being released. The three most prevalent types of air-positive displacement compressors found in small and medium-sized companies are rotary screws, vane, and reciprocating air compressors.


Rotary screw compressors

Rotary screws, a typical displacement compressor, are among the simplest air compressors to maintain because they include an internal cooling system that doesn't need any upkeep. 


Reciprocating compressors

Another well-liked variety of displacement compressors is the reciprocating compressor. The reciprocating compressor is not intended for continuous usage, in contrast to the rotary screw compressor.



2. Dynamic Displacement

categories.description:
Cut Off Machine


A cut-off machine is a straightforward yet effective cutting device that is frequently used to cut metal. Two different categories of power tools are referred to as cut-off saws. The miter saw, which is frequently used in woodworking, comes first. The second is an abrasive saw, designed to cut tough materials like ceramic or metal. The article discusses the cut off machine price in Nepal and their different varieties.




Bevel cuts and angled cuts are made precisely with a miter saw. Applications for cutoff machines include concrete and paving, emergency rescue, and building and construction.


Configurations


Cutoff saws are frequently bench-top or manually operated saws, although they can also be purchased separately as free-standing saws. All cutoff machines include an abrasive blade that can be powered by an electric motor or a gasoline engine and allows them to cut through very tough materials.


Types of Cut-Off Saw in Nepal 



Here are a few types of cut off machine :


1. Manual Miter Saw


To make precise miter cuts, a manual miter saw uses a miter box and a metal guide. Although power woodworking equipment has mostly taken the place of these cut-off saws, they are still infrequently employed in picture framing or manual woodworking.


2. Power Miter Saw


A power miter saw is a tool for making precise cuts quickly and at the correct angle. It is frequently employed in cutting and framing processes. The majority of miter saws are lightweight and portable, and their typical blade diameters range from eight to twelve inches.


3. Abrasive Saw


A power instrument used to cut tough materials is an abrasive saw. The cutting operation is carried out by an abrasive disc, which resembles a narrow grinding wheel. The cutting wheel and motor are installed on a free arm that is attached to a fixed base plate, and it features an integrated vise or clamp.



Cut-Off Saw Safety Tips


  1. Although a face shield may appear unnecessary in some situations, it is highly advised to protect oneself from potentially harmful injuries.
  2. You must put on a mask to cover your nose if the dust-collecting system is ineffective.
  3. Before installing the cut-off wheel, check for cracks or other damage.
  4. Never exert any sideways force on the wheel that is parting off. Since the parting-off wheels have very narrow cross sections, this may lead to wheel fracture.
  5. Sparks produced during the cutting operation may be seen. To reduce the risk of a fire, keep flammable materials away from chop saws.
  6. Avoid using a cut-off wheel to attempt to cut materials like wood, plywood, plastic, etc. as this could cause the wheel to load up.

Heat Guns price in Nepal


A stream of hot air is frequently blown by heat gun equipment. These power-driven equipment are commonly utilized in engineering applications, labs, and workshops. Types of Heat Guns


Heat guns come in a variety of varieties and have various uses. Here are a few popular heat gun types that you may find online.


1. Corded Heat Guns


These heat guns are electrically powered and must be plugged in before use. It is essential that you are constantly conscious of the cord's length and the location of your heat gun. Using an extension cord to enable you to work on odd angles can boost the safety and usability of this heat gun.


2. Cordless Heat Guns


Since they are battery-operated, cordless heat guns don't need circuits to operate. They are convenient to use, move, and carry around because of this characteristic.

It is important to remember that these heat guns have a maximum temperature of 1,000°C (1,800°F), hence the majority of their heating elements are coated in ceramic.


4. Infrared Heat Gun


IR heat is used by infrared heat guns. These weapons can withstand temperatures as high as 400°C to 600°C (752°F to 1,112°F). However, because infrared heat prevents the release of hazardous gasses, these infrared heat guns are pocket-friendly and perfect for DIY projects.

Concrete Mixer Price in Nepal


A concrete mixer is a tool that assists men in rapidly and concisely preparing a concrete mixture of various strengths. There aren't many concrete mixing devices that work well for creating mixtures on building sites. Concrete mixer price in Nepal and all kinds will be covered in this article.





Gravel, sand, water, and cement are all uniformly mixed for making concrete. Concrete mixing is the process of combining sand, water, gravel, and concrete. 


Types of Concrete Mixers in Nepal


Concrete mixers can be divided into two main categories:


1. Batch mixer


Concrete is produced in batches by a particular type of mixer called a batch mixer. The first batch of ingredients is added to one side of the machine, and then the mixed material is removed. The following section discusses various batch mixer classifications.


Drum Mixer


There is a cross-segment holder on every drum mixer. Inside the mobile drum, the knives are linked. Their fundamental strategy is to raise the objects while the drum rotates. Three further variations of drum mixers include:


  1. Tilting Drum Mixers - The tilting drum mixer, as its name implies, has a phenomenon that enables it to spin and rotate. More energy is given to the material inside the drum when it is horizontal (at a 0-degree angle with the x-axis), causing the material to be lifted to its full height before falling. 

  1. Non-tilting drum mixers - Non-tilting drum mixers have a horizontal axis rotation and no tilting is permitted. When ingredients are poured at one end and the mixture is collected through the other, the drum is split open at both ends and has blades inside. 


  1. Reversing drum mixers - These mixers are quite similar to non-shifting drum mixers; both ends of the mixers have apertures through which the components of the concrete mixture are poured in and the finished product is discharged. 



Pan Mixers


Concrete is mixed in a circular pan using pan-style mixers. Blades arranged in a star pattern inside the pan combine the ingredients. There are two different kinds of pan mixers. In one instance, the circular pan remains stationary while just the star blades spin around the pan's vertical axis. 



2. Continuous Mixer


These mixers continue to continually deliver concrete without any interruptions. Sand, cement, water, and gravel are the raw materials, and they are continuously added from one end and continuously removed from the other. Such reliable mixers are put up on the construction site itself.

The operation of an electric water heater is quite similar to that of a gas water heater. The dip tube (1) is used to introduce cold water, which is then heated by the electric heating components (2) inside the tank. Through the heat-out pipe, the hot water rises in the tank and is distributed throughout the house.

categories.title: Electric Blower
categories.description:
Electric Blower Price in Nepal


A blower is, simply put, a tool that raises the velocity of air passing through it. A blower's main purpose is to transfer gas and air under low to high pressure in order to carry out a specified task. The article discusses the electric blower price in Nepal and their several varieties.





Blowers are used in a wide range of industrial applications, such as cooling, conveying, ventilating, exhausting, etc. When the required pressure lies between that of a fan and that of a compressor, blowers are frequently utilized.


How Do Blowers Function?


Blowers function by increasing the pressure of either air or gas through a rotor's centrifugal action. Through an inlet valve, the blower draws in air or gas, which rotates the impellers (or rotors) and generates centrifugal force, which pushes the air or gas. The air or gas is continually compressed during this process, and the pressure increases linearly.


The following list includes typical blower types in Nepal :



1. Positive Displacement Blowers


Positive displacement blowers function in a rather straightforward way and are ideal for applications using either air or neutral gas. The blower has a part on one side that expands to take in air or gas, and it has a section on the other side that contracts to take it out. Positive displacement of the air happens as it is expelled via the contracting side, increasing air pressure.


2. Centrifugal Blowers


Usually, high pressure and variable flow are required in applications where centrifugal blowers are used. These blowers contain rotating impellers, which cause the air (or gas) that pass through to move more quickly. Additionally, the air turns 90 degrees as it enters the blower's fan wheel and escapes at a faster rate than it entered. 


3. High-Speed Blowers


High-speed blowers are powered by a motor and are intended for high-pressure (up to 25 psi) and high-flow (up to 15,000 m3 per hour) needs. High-speed blowers have impellers on either side that create dual suction, much like centrifugal blowers do. One can attach it to a permanent magnet motor with a variable frequency drive thanks to the directly connected impellers.


4. Regenerative Blowers


Regenerative blowers are made for situations were moving a lot of air at low pressure is necessary. Regenerative blowers frequently contain oil-free parts, making them not only simple to maintain but also safe, particularly in situations used in the food and beverage industry and the medical sector. It is simple to utilize for a variety of low-pressure applications. 


5. Multistage Centrifugal Blowers


A form of centrifugal blower that turns the machine to raise the air pressure is known as a multistage centrifugal blower. It has an electric motor that can withstand high pressure. A multistage centrifugal blower can be used for a variety of tasks, such as improving landfill gas production, the wastewater treatment sector, and powering artificial lungs.

categories.description:
Welding Machine Price In Nepal

This pricing guide will describe the welding machine price in Nepal and cover the various kinds of welding machines like MIG welding machines, TIG welding machines, Spot welding machines, and others, along with their uses and visual explanation.



Welding is a production procedure that uses a fusion technique to combine materials like metals or thermoplastics and the tool used to complete the procedure is a welding machine. Welding is distinct from low-temperature processes that melt the base metal, such as brazing and soldering. 



Types of Welding Machines in Nepal :


Depending on the type of welding operation, there are several welding machine types in the business. 


1. MIG Welding Machine 


Machines for metal inert gas welding are typically utilized for large, thick materials. The consumable wire that the welder uses must serve as both the electrode and the filler material. This procedure takes less time and produces goods at a lesser cost than TIG welding. 


2. TIG Welding Machine


Because they create precise and clean welds, tungsten inert gas welding equipment is excellent for thin metals and smaller tasks. A tungsten electrode that generates a weld and is non-consumable must be used by the welder. When used on metals like mild steel, stainless steel, or aluminum, these devices produce a strong weld. 


3. Spot Welding Machine


By applying pressure and heat to the weld region with an electric current, spot welding is a resistance welding technique used to join two or more metal sheets together. These devices have benefits like efficient power utilization, rapid production, straightforward automation, etc. 


4. Thyristor MIG Welding Machine


The best accuracy and hard-ground parts are used to build these kinds of welding equipment. The majority of welders favor using this welding machine to mount objects on the proper surface or fix them. These tools work well for welding flux- and solid-core materials.


5. Shielded Metal Arc Welding Machine


Shielded metal arc welding equipment typically operates on the basis of the heat generated by an electric arc. Stick welding is another name for these processes, which include passing an electric current across the space between the metal and the welding stick (filler rod). Both AC and DC currents can be used to power SMAW machines.


6. Energy Beam Welding Machine


The device applies the materials to be connected with a high-speed stream of closely concentrated electrons utilizing magnetic fields. It is possible to fuse thick metals into thin metals using an energy beam welding machine. Additionally, the welder has the ability to join various metals.


7. Plastic Welding Machine


To combine plastic components and mend cracks, plastic welding machines are employed. Plastic materials are first connected, and then under pressure, when welding. These welding equipment shorten cycle times while improving strength.

DSLR Camera Price in Nepal


The DSLR is the digital equivalent of the analog SLR (Single Lens Reflex) camera. Due to their variety of features and capacity to generate images of a professional caliber, DSLRs have been among the most widely used camera types for the past 15 years. A DSLR is created by a number of factors. First of all, it only employs one interchangeable lens. As long as the appropriate lens is utilized, this enables you to record any kind of situation. Second, the camera body contains a mechanical mirror system. The photographer can see the light and scene through the viewfinder thanks to a condenser lens and a pentaprism or pentamirror.



Types of DSLR Cameras in Nepal



Full-frame and crop sensor DSLR cameras come in two different varieties. The size of the image sensor is the only distinction between them.




1. Full-Frame Sensor Camera


In terms of DSLR cameras, a full-frame sensor camera has the largest type of camera sensor. Comparable in size to a single slide of 35mm film. Images with a full-frame sensor have a higher resolution than those taken with a crop-sensor camera. Comparatively, the quality and resolution of your photographs are impacted by the sensor size, which has an effect on the level of detail. The number of pixels a sensor can hold increases with size. It will therefore have a better resolution as a result. You can catch more of the scene's details if your resolution is higher. 


2. Crop Sensor Camera


A DSLR with a sensor that is smaller than a full frame is known as a crop sensor model. Crop sensors come in a few different sizes. The most popular sizes are Canon's 22.2x14.8mm and Nikon's 23.6x15.7mm. There is less physical space for pixels on a smaller sensor. Lower resolution results from fewer pixels. Get to know the latest bike price in Nepal here at Fatafat Sewa. A motorcycle is a two- or three-wheeled motor vehicle. It is also referred to as a motorbike, bike, or cycle. Long-distance travel, commuting, cruising, sport, and off-road riding all require quite diverse motorcycle designs.



There are numerous things to think about when buying a motorbike, whether you're a beginner or an experienced rider looking to improve. You must choose between new and secondhand motorcycles, determine your budget, and find a motorcycle that suits your riding style.


It's crucial to understand how the bike feels to ride, though. When looking for bikes, we advise you to test drive a variety of motorcycles to determine which is best for you. For your first ride, we've listed our suggestions for nice motorcycles below.

Online Liquor Nepal


Fatafat Sewa is the best online liquor Nepal store out there. Almost every mixed cocktail requires alcohol as an ingredient. There are numerous varieties of liquor manufactured from a wide range of ingredients, giving them rich flavors and distinctive applications. We’ve gathered a list below that explains all types of liquor, along with signature drinks made with each so you can get an idea of what you can use each hard alcohol in when making mixed drinks. 



Alcohol is typically produced by distilling materials that have undergone fermentation. Sugars are fermented to create alcohol, which is subsequently concentrated through the distillation of extra water.


liquor store near me


Based on your needs for drinking, you can pick from a selection of liquor brands in Nepal. From a list of the top online liquor platforms that Fatafat Sewa has offered, you can select the bar prices in Nepal that are to your taste. Our website contains more information about it. Fatafat Sewa is a well-known internet merchant in Lalitpur with extensive knowledge of beverage delivery in Nepal. We offer a wide range of services in Nepal, including the delivery of rum, liqueurs, wine, tequila, and many other alcoholic beverages. As the leading liquor distributors in Nepal, we make every effort to provide the best delivery service.



Types of liquors 



1. Brandy


  1. Brandy is an elegant spirit that is frequently combined in a mixed cocktail with a small number of other ingredients. Brandy tastes a lot like wine since it contains a lot of fruit-based components. The liquor develops a taste that is practically burned in addition to having a wine-like profile as it ages in wood barrels, usually made of oak. Brandy typically contains between 35 and 60% more alcohol than wine. Similar to whiskey and brandy, cognac is a type of alcoholic beverage.


2. Tequila 


  1. Tequila is a distilled drink that is largely produced in the region of Tequila in the Jaliscan Highlands (Los Altos de Jalisco), a state in central-western Mexico. Tequila has a wide range of flavors depending on how it is aged, just like other spirits. Tequila can be drunk in a variety of ways, including in margaritas and other mixed drinks, but its most well-known use is in shots. Tequila is a special kind of alcoholic beverage since only certain regions of Mexico may make it in order for it to be called authentic tequila.


3. Vodka 


  1. Vodka is a distilled spirit that is clear. Polish, Russian, and Swedish origins can be traced to several types. The basic ingredients in vodka are water and ethanol, though there may also be small amounts of flavorings and contaminants. Because potatoes were introduced in Europe in the 1700s, the traditional method of making them involved distilling the liquid obtained from fermented cereal grains. Some contemporary brands base their products on fruits, honey, or maple sap.


4. Rum


  1. Unlike the manufacturing of brandy and other alcoholic beverages, rum does not include the fermentation of grains. Rum is produced by fermenting molasses or sugarcane. Different aging processes lead to different types of rum. The typical alcohol level is 40%, however, over-proof varieties can have up to 75% alcohol by volume. Rum originated in the Caribbean, despite the fact that there are distilleries all over the world. Given the roots of the spirit, tropical and summertime drinks pair well with them.


5. Whisky


  1. Whisky is a distilled beverage that is popular all around the world but is most commonly consumed in Ireland, Scotland and the United States. While whiskeys can vary in ingredients and production, the basic overall process for producing a high-quality whisky is the same. Whiskey has unquestionably endured the test of time and has been passed down and savored throughout the ages. It's not uncommon for whisky aficionados to swear by their preferred year, distillery, or area. Yarchagumba whisky is a domestic whisky available in Nepal.


6. Wine


  1. Usually made from fermented grapes, wine is an alcoholic beverage. The sugar in the grapes is broken down by yeast into ethanol and carbon dioxide, producing heat in the process. Major determinants of various wine types include different yeast strains and grape kinds. These variations are the consequence of intricate interactions between the terroir—the grape's natural growing environment—the fermentation reactions, the grape's biochemical development, and the wine-making process. A lot of nations have adopted legal appellations that specify wine styles and attributes.

Beer Price in Nepal


In this article, we shall talk about the beer price in Nepal and its numerous varieties that will help consumers to make the decision to purchase one.


So how is beer made?


Beer is created during the brewing process by fermenting the starch sugars in the wort, which results in the production of ethanol and carbonation.   


Hops, which impart bitterness and other flavors as well as serve as a natural preservative and stabilizing agent, are used in the majority of current beers. The natural carbonation effect in commercial brewing is frequently lost during processing and replaced with induced carbonation.


Beer shop near me


Depending on your consumption needs, you can select from a list of beer brands in Nepal. On Fatafat Sewa, you can purchase premium beer brands directly from major distributors while also benefiting from our delivery service in and around Kathmandu, Nepal. From our list of the top online beer marketplaces, you may select the beer prices in Nepal that best suit your preferences. Our website contains more information about it. Cash on delivery is an option for customers in the Kathmandu valley, and we ship goods all around Nepal. At Fatafat Sewa, you can buy online liquor Nepal 24 hours.


Types of Beer in Nepal :


The costs and the many types of beer are included in this pricing guide. 


1. Ale


The broad genre of beer is called ale. Brown beers and pale ales are examples of subcategories. This beer's history can be traced back to ancient times. Ale can be identified by its brief warm-temperature fermentation, which also makes this type of beer approachable for home brewers.


2. Lager


Lagers are a more recent type of beer that differ from ales in two important ways. Lagers require bottom-fermenting yeasts, which perform their magic by sinking to the bottom of the fermenting tank, to ferment for a long time at a low temperature. Lagers are popular throughout Europe.


3. Porter


Porter beers, a subgenre of ale, are distinguished by their deep black color and roasted malt flavor and fragrance. The type of roasted malt used in the brewing process determines whether porters will taste fruity or dry.



4. Stout


Stouts are dark, roasted ales like porters. Stouts have a less sweet flavor than porters and frequently have a bitter coffee flavor from the addition of unmalted roasted barley to the wort. They have a big, creamy head that gives them away. One of the most well-known stouts in the world is perhaps Ireland's Guinness.



5. Blonde Ale


Due to its gentle malt sweetness and traces of aromatic hops, this easy-to-drink brew is a summertime favorite. Blonde ales have a clear body and a light hue, as their name suggests. As opposed to being too hoppy or dank, they are often crisp and dry with little to no bitterness.



6. Brown Ales


Brown ales can be amber to brown in color and have flavors of nuts, citrus, chocolate, or caramel. Since the various malts used and the country of origin may significantly alter the flavor and aroma of this underappreciated beer variety, brown ales are a bit of a mixed bag.



7. Pale Ale


The APA, or American Pale Ale, is a variant of the pale ale that is related to the original English pale ale and the IPA type. American pale ales typically contain American two-row malt and are hoppier. Pale ales are a type of English beer distinguished by their copper color and fruity aroma.



8. Wheat


Wheat beers are a simple, light beer variety with a pleasant flavor and hazy appearance. Hefeweizen, or unfiltered wheat beer, is one of the most popular varieties. Wheat beers typically taste like spices or citrus.

categories.title: Whisky
categories.description:
Whisky Price in Nepal

Here is our guide to understanding the whisky price in Nepal and various whisky varieties found worldwide. Whisky is produced by distilling different and/or particular grains (including corn, wheat, rye, oats, and barley) and aging it in barrels. 


In its most basic form, 99.9% of the time, whiskey is just distilled beer without hops. The sugars in the grains are steeped and fermented, turning them into alcohol. Every grain has a variable amount of sugar.


Online Whisky home delivery near me


There are many different whisky brands available in Nepal, so you can choose one that best suits your preferences. With our delivery service in and around Kathmandu, Nepal, you may get top whisky brands straight from major distributors on Fatafat sewa. You can choose the whisky prices in Nepal from our list of the greatest online whisky markets. You can also look for the Yarchagumba whisky price in Nepal at Fatafatsewa. More details regarding it are available on our website. Customers in the Kathmandu valley have the option of paying cash upon delivery, and we send goods all around Nepal. Fatafat sewa is known for the best online alcohol delivery in kathmandu.



Types of Whisky in Nepal



So without further ado, here are the whiskey varieties you should be familiar with:


1. Irish Whisky


The flavor of Irish whiskey is softer than that of other whiskeys. It is created from a malt mash, can only be distilled with water and caramel coloring, and has a minimum three-year distillation requirement in wooden casks. While Irish whiskey can be used to prepare cocktails, the end result is a whiskey that is simple to enjoy neat or on the rocks.


2. Scotch Whisky


In Scotland, malt or grain is used to create Scotch whisky, also known as just scotch. The laws that distillers are required to abide by reflect how seriously the Scots take their whisky production. Additionally, each bottle must include an age statement that indicates the youngest aged whisky that was utilized to create that blend.


3. Japanese Whisky


Japanese whisky, which entered the spirits market a little later than Irish and Scotch, has distinguished itself thanks to its excellent standards. Japanese whisky was developed using identical distillation techniques to scotch whisky in order to taste as comparable as possible. It is typically consumed with a dash of soda or mixed beverages.


4. Canadian Whisky


Canadian whisky must spend at least three years in a barrel, just like scotch. Because it has a higher corn content than other types of whiskey, it is lighter and smoother. The majority of Canadian whiskies are manufactured from rye and maize, but some may also contain wheat or barley.


5. Bourbon Whisky


Bourbon is a corn-based whiskey prepared in the American style. In truth, a spirit must be brewed in America, aged in a new oak barrel, and contain at least 51% maize to be referred to as bourbon whiskey. It must be bottled at 80 proof or higher and has no minimum aging requirement.


6. Tennessee Whisky


Despite the fact that Tennessee whiskey is technically categorized as bourbon, not all of the state's distillers are fans of it. Instead, Tennessee whiskey is used to describe their style. State law mandates that all contemporary Tennessee whiskey makers create their bourbons in Tennessee and filter them using the Lincoln County Process before maturing them.


7. Rye Whisky


American rye whiskey must contain at least 51% rye; barley and corn are also used in their production. It replicates the bourbon distillation process. Straight rye whiskey is a rye that has matured for two or more years without being blended. Compared to sweeter, smoother bourbon, rye typically has a spicier flavor.


8. Blended Whisky


Blended whiskey is precisely what its name implies; it's a combination of various whiskey varieties, as well as colorings, tastes, and sometimes even additional grains. These whiskeys are perfect for mixing since the technique lets the flavor come through while keeping the price of the spirit cheap.



How do I purchase Whisky in Nepal?


On our website, Fatafat sewa, you may buy whisky online. Once you've decided which item to purchase, take the steps to complete the transaction online. Purchases can generally be made in three different ways.


1. Through the website Fatafat sewa


Before placing a product in your shopping cart, you can decide whether or not you wish to buy it. You can go to checkout after you have added something. You are all set after the payment process is complete. You'll get a call shortly to confirm your order. Simply choose yes to confirm that the order and product will be delivered to your address in a few days.


2. Fatafat sewa Phone order 


Call 9828757575 if you have any inquiries about the goods or need help understanding the procedure. To prevent confusion, you must offer comprehensive information on the product you select.


3. Visit Fatafat sewa store


Please feel free to visit us if you have any questions regarding the item you plan to buy. Our store is located in Lalitpur on Jhamsikhel Road-3. You can learn more about the items and get more information by visiting this page. If your purchase has a deadline, stick to this strategy.


You can also view:

Whisky is a popular alcoholic beverage enjoyed by many people around the world. In Nepal, whisky is widely consumed, and there are many different brands and varieties available on the market. If you're curious about the regular whisky price in Nepal, read on to find out more.


The price of regular whisky in Nepal can vary depending on a few factors, such as the brand, type of whisky, and location. In general, the average price for a 750ml bottle of regular whisky in Nepal is around NPR 3,000 to NPR 5,000 (approximately USD 25 to USD 42). Single Malt Whisky Price in Nepal

Single malt whisky is a popular choice among whisky enthusiasts in Nepal. This type of whisky is made from 100% malted barley and is typically aged for at least three years. Single malt whisky is often considered to be of higher quality than blended whisky, which is made from a combination of different whiskies. In Nepal, the price of single malt whisky can vary depending on the brand and age of the whisky. On average, a 750ml bottle of single malt whisky in Nepal can cost anywhere from NPR 6,000 to NPR 25,000 (approximately USD 50 to USD 210). Some of the most popular brands of single malt whisky in Nepal include Glenfiddich, Macallan, Highland Park, and Lagavulin. When shopping for single malt whisky in Nepal, it's important to keep in mind that prices can vary depending on where you purchase it and which brand you choose.

Gin Price in Nepal

Gin is among the world's most popular alcoholic beverages. By the early 17th century, it had taken many diverse forms in England. Gin comes with varieties of brands and one can find the perfect alcohol at a great price in Nepal. Gin, the national spirit of England, is mainly produced in the UK and has changed from being a herbal remedy to a beverage used for mixing in cocktails. Here, we will be discussing the gin price in Nepal.





Due to its harsh texture, gin is often combined with other ingredients to create drinks, the Martini is the most well-known. Nowadays, the consumption of gin has increased in Nepal. Gin can cheer any occasion or mood. Despite the use of botanicals and other sweet ingredients (like licorice) in its preparation, gin is often not a sweet liquor. Gin may come in sweeter varieties, like Plymouth Gin, but it isn't generally thought of as a sweet-tasting liquor.


To give Gin its distinctive pine flavor extra ingredients, mainly juniper berries, are used. In fact, juniper must be present in Gin to be termed Gin. Price ranges for the Gin (small to large) start at Rs. 349 for Blue Riband Gin and go up to Rs. 9300 for Bombay Sapphire.



Brand of Gin available in Nepal


Here are the gin brands available in Nepal.



1. Hendrick’s Jin


Hendrick's Gin uses two spirits types refined using two separate types of stills. The first mixture is created in a Bennett still (small), which is used to combine grain liquor, carbonated water, and herbs. It is then kept for 24 hours to rest before being refined. The second mix eliminates the typical bubbling cycle and places the botanicals on top of the refining section instead. Hendrick's is distinguished from other gins by the unique flavor that results from the remarkable blending ratio of rose and cucumber. It is the imported Gin brand available in Nepal.

Price of 700Ml: Rs.6990/-(Approx).

Ingredients: Include roses, cucumbers, juniper, angelica, orris root, cubeb berries, caraway seeds, chamomile, elderflower, and yarrow berries, in addition to the other 11 botanicals.



2. Monkey 47 Gin


The Monkey 47 is a rare German gin from the Black Forest. It has a strong flavor and is a true spirit of the highest caliber. The number 47 comes from the number of vegetable ingredients that are used in this gin. The primary ingredient in this gin is cranberries. It has been produced since 2008. This gin ensures that you return for more and more of it.

Price of 500Ml: Rs.8550/- (Approx).

Ingredients: angelica root, acacia flowers, bramble leaves, lingonberries, and spruce shoots are the ingredients used to make it.



3. Beefeater


Beefeater is entirely distilled from grain. There are nine botanical components used in Beefeater Gin, including Seville Oranges, Orris Roots, Almonds, Angelica seeds and roots, and Liquorices, all of which are exclusive to Beefeater Gin. Before beginning the cycle of refining, all of the nine herbal ingredients were soaked for a whole day. It is sent to Scotland for additional mixing after 8 hours of refining, which creates the most delectable Beefeater flavor. 40 percent of Beefeater is alcohol. It distills using a very complex technique.

Price of 1L: Rs.5880/-(Approx).

Ingredients: juniper, angelica root, angelica seeds, coriander seeds, licorice, almonds, orris root, Seville oranges, and lemon peel are the ingredients used to make it.

Vodka price in Nepal

A clear distilled alcoholic beverage is vodka. Are you looking for the best Vodka price in Nepal? In this article, we are talking about Vodka. Due to its versatility, vodka is the most popular alcoholic beverage in most countries. Because of the option of creating cocktails, even those who do not really appreciate the flavor of alcohol might enjoy this. 


Price ranges for the Vodka (small to large) start at Rs.840/- for Highlander Vodka 750ML and go up to Rs.7,730/- for Belvedere Citrus 700ML.  


Types of Vodka



1. Plain Vodka


The higher 90s range for the alcohol concentration of this kind of vodka. Many people don't particularly concerned about the taste because they view this beverage as a standard. You use this as the foundation for other cocktails. They frequently have no taste and are quite pure, containing just a very small amount of contaminants.


However, several companies have tested this with key parts to improving the simple flavor. Good brands like Pristine Vodka sell basic vodka with a hint of citrus, spice, and crisp flavors. But at its essence, simple vodka excels at one task: giving our cocktails the necessary kick.


The sort of alcohol used to manufacture the basic vodka has a significant impact on how it tastes. Starting with a concentration of 95% alcohol, the mixture is put through many distillations to balance the head and tail preserve the heart (which is made of pure alcohol) and dilute the tail (a final distillation of up to 5%).


2. Flavored Vodka


These vodkas have become popular because they already have a flavor profile, and these vodkas have grown in popularity over the past few years. As soon as you discover a taste you like, you can enjoy mixers and juices without having to purchase them. Also pretty amazing are the flavor profiles, which include cinnamon, blueberries, oranges, green apples, lemons, limes, and a plethora of others.


Sales of Vodka are more than whiskey, gin, and brandy combined, making it one of the most popular alcoholic beverages. Fruit vodkas and vodkas with flavors are not the same things. However, they begin with 95% alcohol, similar to how pure vodka is made, and after distillation, the flavor profile is infused to produce a distinctive taste. The vodkas here are all 40% proof.


What kind of taste profile they are going to create often varies from one brand to another. As a result, you won't get the same flavor if you purchase lime vodkas from two separate companies. Finding the ideal flavored vodka may require some trial and error, but it will be worth it in the end.


3. Fruit Vodka


These vodkas, as the name implies, are made from fruit extracts. The same process is used to make vodkas with herbal flavors, which can also be grouped under this heading. These vodkas require substantially more time to produce than regular, plain vodka. However, they simply have a richer flavor profile, aroma, and color than any other vodka that is produced in large quantities for widespread consumption.


These vodkas begin with a base of 50 to 80% alcohol. To fully extract the fruit flavor from the liquor, this is blended with the fruit combination for up to three weeks. The rind is meticulously filtered after the three weeks are up so as not to disrupt the alcohol.


The vodka can now be combined with any additional flavors to give it a richer body and personality. The beverage is then allowed to mature for a period of time so that the rich flavor can emerge. The majority of the flavor profile of the drink is created by the aging process, which is comparable to that of other pricey alcoholic beverages like wine and whiskey. The volatiles, which are drinkable substances that store taste and release it gradually, are built up over time.


4. Grain Vodka


One of the driest varieties of vodka ever created, this one starts with almost 96% concentrated alcohol. The infusion and distillation process is commonly started by mixing pure rye alcohol with water. It's safe to assume that not everyone will enjoy this, and only ardent vodka lovers will try and enjoy this kind.


Typically, the majority of grain vodkas are offered in nations with really harsh winters, and this beverage is regarded as excellent for warming up at this time. It goes without saying that you won't find this variety in the typical booze section of a supermarket.

There are almost as many ways to enjoy Absolut Vodka Original as there are times it is distilled, which is limitless. Keep it nice or combine it with others. To make the ideal Absolut Vodka Soda, combine soda water, lime juice, and a few lime slices.


3. Eristoff Vodka Price in Nepal


In France, neutral spirit (we assume wheat) is used to make Eristoff, which is filtered using charcoal. In Mainland Europe, where it is promoted as a "standard" vodka, it has high volume sales.

Eristoff vodka isn't the most simple vodka to consume However, it has a slightly sweet flavor, and the aftertaste is even sweeter.

Despite not being flavored, the vodka has vanilla and caramel undertones. It is a distinctively rich, incredibly smooth vodka with a warm, creamy mouthfeel that is perfect for enjoying neat or over ice. The lovely embossed bottle is a nice complement to your home bar and is a thoughtful gift.

categories.title: Rum
categories.description:
Rum Price in Nepal


Rum is a distilled spirit made from molasses or sugar cane juice. Before being sold and utilized in beverages, the alcohol is next fermented and kept in barrels. The spirit of rum is so varied. This article will go over the rum price in Nepal as well as the different varieties.




There are numerous choices when it comes to the various rum varieties. Knowing what flavor or type you want can help you decide which one is better for cocktails and drinking.


Types of Rums in Nepal : 


We shall examine various rum varieties in this post, including premium aged rums and white, dark, black, and gold rums.


1. White Rum


White rum is often referred to as transparent rum, silver rum, or light rum due to its lack of color. Prior to being marketed, white rum is typically matured for less than a year. Charcoal filtering is typically used to remove the color from aged white rum.


2. Dark Rum


Due to the prolonged fermentation process, which draws out more rum characteristics from the sugarcane or molasses basis, dark rum has a richer flavor than light rum. To achieve a rich color and robust flavor, darker rums are often matured for a longer period of time in charred oak barrels.


3. Gold Rum


Amber or golden rum, also referred to as pale rum, has a medium body. Because amber rum is typically aged longer and for a longer period of time in hardwood barrels, it has a deeper color than light rum. They have a sweeter flavor than light rums and may have hints of banana, butterscotch, vanilla, molasses, and chocolate.


4. Navy Rum


Navy Rum, often known as navy strength rum, got its name from the rum rations served to soldiers aboard Royal Navy ships between 1850 and 1970. Typically, this sort of rum has an ABV of 54-57%. (alcohol by volume). Since it won't be diluted by other components, it is ideal for adding to tiki drinks.


5. Rhum Agricole


Rhum Agricole, a beverage from the French Caribbean islands, is made from sugar cane juice rather than molasses. Additionally, it is made in Australia, Thailand, Mauritius, and Hawaii, all in the Pacific Ocean. When compared to rum made with molasses, rhum agricole has a fruitier and more robust flavor.


6. Overproof Rum


ABV (alcohol by volume) over 50% indicates that the alcohol is overproof. Typically, overproof rums are added to mixed beverages to give them an extra kick. Because overproof rum has a high alcohol level and rapidly cools the lips and tongue, drinking it over ice is a common practice.


7. Premium Aged Rums


Because premium rum is typically matured in oak barrels for a number of years, it has a stronger flavor than standard rum. It is a little more expensive than other types of rum because the production takes longer. Aged or mature rum can be sipped neat or over ice, earning it the nickname "sipping rum."


8. Single Vintage Rums


These unique rums, which should not be confused with aged rums, are bottled from particular production years. Diplomatico Single Vintage Rum 2005 is an illustration of a single vintage rum. Before being transferred to Oloroso sherry barrels, this premium rum spends 12 years maturing in bourbon and whiskey barrels.


9. Spiced Rum


Spiced rum has a flavor of spices and is dark amber in color. Rum is blended with flavors like caramel and vanilla in a base of alcohol. Fruits like oranges and botanicals are occasionally included. This kind of rum, also referred to as flavored rum, is frequently sweet and used in punch and drinks.

Fruit juices and other refreshments are an essential part of a healthy lifestyle. Juice price in Nepal depends upon Fruit variety, place of origin, degree of ripeness, and juice quality. A liquid called juice can be produced from plants, animals, or fruit. Fruit juice in Nepal has a very high demand because it has a variety of benefits. 




Fruit juice is commonly turned into a drink. There are numerous fruits that are frequently turned into drinks, like apples, oranges, tomatoes, pineapples, grapefruits, guavas, mangoes, passionfruits, watermelons, cranberries, grapes, lemons, and limes.


Types of Juice available in Nepal


Juice is produced from a wide variety of fruits and vegetables today. This section covers all the facts you need to know about each type of juice, from nutrition information to suggested recipes, so you can decide whether to stay with your old favorites or try some new ones. Some of them are listed below:


1. Apple Juice


The majority of apple juice has vitamin C added to it. Cellular growth and repair depend on vitamin C. Additionally, it helps in wound healing, develops strong teeth, skin, bones, and cartilage, and is essential for a strong immune system. According to a recent study, youngsters who drink diluted apple juice are better hydrated than those who drink conventional electrolyte drinks.


2. Pomegranate Juice


Potassium, which supports blood pressure control, neuron and muscle function, and fluid balance, is found in high levels in pomegranate juice. Anthocyanins, a type of natural antioxidant, are present in pomegranate juice. Pomegranate juice consumption may also support stable blood pressure. This can lessen muscular discomfort.


3. Orange Juice


Vitamin C, thiamin (vitamin B1), folate, and potassium are all present in good amounts in orange juice. Vitamin B1 is crucial for proper nerve function, muscular function, and the body's ability to process energy from food. Folate helps in the production of DNA and healthy cells in your body. 


4. Carrot Juice


Beta-carotene, vitamin A, and potassium are all present in carrot juice in good amounts. Immune system health, female reproduction, and eye health all benefit from vitamin A. Potassium is crucial for maintaining a healthy fluid balance in the body as well as for normal neuron, muscle, and blood pressure function.


5. Pineapple Juice


Some pineapple juices have calcium, vitamins A and E, and other additives. The daily value of your favorite pineapple juice can be found on the label. Manganese, a trace mineral that helps create strong bones and connective tissues, can make up to 73% of the essential requirements in pineapple juice. Additionally, copper is present, which promotes normal blood pressure and iron absorption.

categories.description:
Brandy Price in Nepal


Brandy is a liquor produced by fermented wine. Brandy generally contains 35 – 60% alcohol with 80 to 100 proof. Grapes are used to making traditional brandy. The alcohol contains in brandy varies depending on its type.




Brandy price in Nepal range (small to large) starts at Rs.800/- and goes up to Rs.42,000/- (Approx). Other fruits fall into two-order pome brandy from apples and pears, while gravestones fruit brandies use apricots, cherries, peaches, and gems.



Types of Brandy


So let's introduce you to the various varieties of brandy in order to throw some light on the topic of the alcoholic spirit.


1. French Brandy


Each region of France has its unique microclimate and distinct variations in the soil's composition. This has caused some substantially diverse varieties of brandy to be produced over the years.


Cognac Brandy


Cognac, the world's most well-known brandy, can only be produced using grapes produced in the 79,000-hectare AOC region of South West France. Not only that, but brandy must go through a difficult production procedure and be distilled twice in copper pot stills in order to legally use the term "Cognac." 


Armagnac Brandy


Similar to Cognac, which comes from South West France and extends into the Pyrenees Mountain foothills, Armagnac is a grape brandy. Similar to Cognac, Armagnac is a grape brandy with AOC certification. The age statements for this brandy are the same as those for Cognac, VS, VSOP, XO, and Hors d'Age. Armagnac and Cognac differ greatly in that Armagnac only goes through one distillation procedure.


Calvados


Calvados, an apple spirit, can be produced further north in the Normandy region. This area of the world is relatively wet, making it the ideal place to cultivate the small, very flavorful apples used to make the liquor. Calvados is aged in wood and can be either double- or single-distilled.


2. Spanish Brandy


Grapes are used to making Spanish brandy. In the Andalucian region of Jerez, 95 percent of the production occurs. The remainder is manufactured in Penedes, a region of Catalonia.


Brandy de Jerez


Brandy must be aged in solera-style casks that have previously held sherry in order to be considered a Brandy de Jerez. The "sherry triangle," which is formed by the villages of Sanlucar de Barrameda, El Puerto de Santa Maria, and Jerez de la Frontera, is also where they must mature. Brandy de Jerez is available in three varieties: Solera, Solera Reserva, and Solera Gran Reserva.


3. Obstler Brandy


Obstler is a fruit brand made in Austria, Switzerland, and Southern Germany's Alpine regions. Fruits like apricots, plums, cherries, apples, pears, or wild berries are used to make it. Schnaps is the name given to it by locals, who describe it as a clear liquid in general. Prior to beginning the maturing process in oak barrels, Obstler is typically double distilled and shares many characteristics with eau-de-vie, the main ingredient in Cognac.


4. Pisco Brandy


Pisco, a brandy from Chile and Peru, is becoming more and more well-liked. This is particularly true in the US, which, after Chile, imports the most tequila. Despite the fact that Pisco is a brandy derived from grape wine, however, it differs greatly from Cognac and Armagnac. The Pisco Sour cocktail is becoming more and more well-known worldwide. 


5. Pomace Brandy


Brandy known as grappa (Pomace )is produced in San Marino, the Italian section of Switzerland, or Italy. Pomace, or the skin, pulp, seeds, and stems left over from making wine, is used to make it. Anywhere in the world can produce pomace brandy, but only Italian pomace brandy can be called grappa.

categories.title: Liquor
categories.description:
Liqueur Price In Nepal

Alcoholic drinks known as liqueurs are packaged with additional sugar and flavorings, which are typically made from fruits, herbs, or nuts. Liqueurs are different from alcohols without added sugar, such as Eaux-de-vie, fruit brandy, and flavored liquors. In this article, we will be talking about the liqueur price In Nepal and the types of liqueur.




Most liqueurs have an alcohol content of between 15% and 55% by volume. The most popular tastes include fruit, berries, coffee, almonds, and chocolate.



Types of Liquors in Nepal


Some individuals label liqueurs primarily according to the producer, and in this instance, depending on their branding and the intricacies of their manufacturing, liqueurs are often classified as either proprietary or generic.


1. Coffee Liqueur


Coffee and alcohol are two of many people's favorite beverages when combined in coffee liqueur. A lot of sugar is added in order to soften the harsh flavor of the alcohol. Other commercially available choices abound, and you may even create your own coffee liqueur at home. There are two types of coffee liqueurs that are manufactured commercially. 


2. Cream liqueur


A Creme Liqueur is an alcoholic liquor that has been sweetened and then flavor added. In contrast to the "regular" liqueur (100g/L) mentioned above, a creme liqueur is required to have at least 250g of sugar per liter. Creme liquors are typically thicker, syrupier, heavier, and (obviously) sweeter than normal liqueurs because of their higher sugar concentration.


3. Fruit Liqueur


Here, the term "fruit" is used broadly to refer to both the botanical definition of a plant structure bearing seeds and a variety of chemically created flavors. Fruit-flavored liqueurs can be made in a reasonably straightforward manner. The most popular and cost-effective production process is blending, which involves combining a neutral spirit with flavoring, coloring, and sugar.


4. Herbal liqueur


Due to the presence of bioactive extractable components derived from herbs, herbal liqueurs are spirits with a variety of functional qualities. Herbal liqueurs are the offspring of old cordials, which were alcoholic extracts or elixirs made from medicinal herbs and thought to have healing effects. They were only utilized to improve overall health and for therapeutic purposes.


5. Whisky Liqueur


Whisky is combined with distilled sugar syrup to create whisky liqueurs, a type of liquor. Whisky liqueurs frequently have fruit or spice flavors added to them and are typically sweeter than whisky. Whisky liqueurs can be sipped neat, incorporated into cocktails, or enjoyed on the rocks. They are a common element in desserts like cheesecakes and trifles and can also be used in cooking.


6. Honey Liqueur


Around the world, a wide range of alcohol bases is used to create honey liqueurs. Other flavorings like anise, cinnamon, or other herbs and spices are frequently found in these liqueurs. These sweet elixirs are typically eaten as shooters, after meals, or in cocktails. There are many different liqueurs that feature honey as a flavoring, and they frequently also contain herbs and spices.


7. Nut Liqueur


Nut liqueurs are produced using a variety of nuts. Nut liqueurs may contain a wide range of nuts or nut combinations, although the most common ones are almonds, hazelnut, and walnut. In order to make nut liqueurs, nuts are normally crushed or crumbled into little pieces and then steeped in the base alcohol for a long time.


8. Flower Liqueur


An intriguing category of liquor is floral liqueurs. One of the most common flowers utilized in the creation of floral liqueurs is the elderflower. Types of Tequila
